availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wiley B. Jones (Christian County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Christian County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth R. Jones. Father of Samuel A. Jones. Resident of Christian County, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned five enslaved persons in Christian County in 1830. Resident of Christian County in 1840. Owned eight enslaved persons in Christian County in 1840. Owned Farmer in Christian County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Farmer in Christian County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Christian County in 1860. Owned Adaline [Unknown], James [Unknown], and Mary Jane [Unknown] in Christian County in 1861.
